Articles.Content:
Watch it live,it begin at 11h30(wich mean:very soon).

here's the source(yes,it is a copy/paste but I have nothing else to say).

Watch live from 11:30 a.m. to 2:30 p.m. EDT today as NASA and the NavyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s United States Fleet Forces Command conduct an Orion Stationary Recovery Test. Testing will simulate the recovery of NASAÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Orion Spacecraft in the Pacific Ocean during the Exploration Flight Test-1 (EFT-1) mission in the fall of 2014. EFT-1 will be Orion's first mission and will see the uncrewed spacecraft launch 3,600 miles into Earth's orbit. After the test flight, Orion will return to Earth at a speed of approximately 20,000 mph for a landing and recovery in the Pacific Ocean. Streaming video will be available on the NASA TV media channel at: http://www.nasa.gov/multimedia/nasatv/ustream_media.html#.UgziqLZgObc.

EDIT:Can I put a prefix after I posted the thread?
How lucky and unusual that I checked in just before it starts.

Only 50 persons watch it at the moment of writing this.

I thought there would be more people than this...
I wonder at what time something will happen...

I think it will be soon:they are going into the boats.

I wonder if the pod is already in the water.
